messages.subject: Re: [AlwaysLearning] San Diego families
messages.msgSnippet: ... I m here!  I m on no email on the SDHE list, so I missed your post. There is an unschooling yahoo group, too, at
messages.messageBody:
On Sep 19, 2006, at 5:03 AM, Tonya Tedesco wrote:

> Hi there,
>
> We may be moving to San Diego (remote chance but none the less) and I
> am wondering how many unschooling families there are in San Diego. I
> have posted on the San Diego Home Education yahoo group and had a few
> very nice replies but thought more of you may be on unschooling groups
> rather than local groups. Anyone? Thanks, Tonya
>

I'm here! I'm on 'no email' on the SDHE list, so I missed your post.
There is an unschooling yahoo group, too, at
http://groups.yahoo.com/group/UnschoolSanDiego/

I think the Unschool group has been planning a park day, but they all
seem to have little kids and I have old kids <g> I've been attending
Tecolote Park Day for many years; it could use some new faces. Many of
the kids are going to charter homeschools now, and a few have opted for
regular high school. There are a few unschoolers, and overall it's a
very inclusive group.

Nancy

messages.subject: San Diego families
messages.msgSnippet: Hi there, We may be moving to San Diego (remote chance but none the less) and I am wondering how many unschooling families there are in San Diego. I have
messages.messageBody:
Hi there,

We may be moving to San Diego (remote chance but none the less) and I
am wondering how many unschooling families there are in San Diego. I
have posted on the San Diego Home Education yahoo group and had a few
very nice replies but thought more of you may be on unschooling groups
rather than local groups. Anyone? Thanks, Tonya
